psl.memento.pervasive.crunch2
Class HttpMetadata

java.lang.Object
  psl.memento.pervasive.crunch2.HttpMetadata
public class HttpMetadata
extends Object

Container class for storing HTTP headers.

Author:
Peter Grimm ( pmg23@psl.cs.columbia.edu )

Constructor Detail

HttpMetadata

public HttpMetadata(int type)
Creates a new http metadata storage structure.

Parameters:
type - the type of metadata to store (Client or Server).
See Also:
CLIENT, SERVER
Method Detail

public void setFirstLine(String line)
Parameters:

getFirstLine

public String getFirstLine()
returns the first line of an http response/request.

Returns:

getFirstLineURI

public URI getFirstLineURI()
Returns:
the URI from the first line (the second token)

set

public void set(String line)
Set a new property or replace an old one using an unparsed http header line. For example "content-type: text/plain"

Parameters:
line - the line containing the property

remove

public void remove(String key)
Removes the metadata specified by the given key.

Parameters:
key - the key of the metadata to be removed.

remove_1

private int remove_1(String key)

get

public String get(String key)
Gets a property, given its name. If the property does not exist, returns an empty string.

Parameters:
key - the name of the property
Returns:
the value of the property

getContentLength

public long getContentLength()
Gets the content length. Returns 0 if the content length not specified and returns -1 if there was an error parsing the value as a long.

Returns:
the content length (the length of the message body).

getURI

public URI getURI()
Gets the URI location of the document. First it tries the host metadata, next it tries the location metadata, and finally it tries to read it from the first line. If none of those exist, it returns null.

Returns:
the URI

toString

public String toString()
Converts the metadata back into an http property set.

Returns:
http property set (header)

reformFirstLine

public void reformFirstLine()
Converts the first line's a url to just a path. Certain servers, such as www.slashdot.org return 501 errors unless this is done.
